thread.title: ‘Why Baseball Matters’ Is the National Pastime Passé?

author: Katherine A. Powers
title: ‘Why Baseball Matters’ Is the National Pastime Passé?
text: Susan Jacoby’s book on baseball is part of the Yale University Press series “Why X Matters,” each volume of which presents, as the Press puts it, “a concise argument for the continuing relevance of an important person or idea.” In other words, Ms. Jacoby is not to blame for a title that promises metaphors and mawkishness of the sort that baseball, considered abstractly, routinely elicits. “Why Baseball Matters” is relatively free of all that, owing, perhaps, to its not having very much to do with why baseball matters. Instead, what we have here is part memoir, part discussion of the game’s evolution and current predicament,...
